Posts.Title: Macmillan coffee day

Posts.Content: Hello Ange68, just wanted to wish you well and all the very best for your op. Wishing you speedy recovery. Take good care
Posts.Title: Big op tomorrow!

Posts.Content: Hello, I agree that this journey is scary and hard at times. For me, getting anxiety attacks is previously unknown to me as I believe in trying my best in being positive. That's why I insisted to know what's happening with me. All the doctor said was my lack of hormones is causing my anxieties. Hope that you will also get better as each day go by. Am sure that we are not the only ones finding it hard. Take good care
Posts.Title: Constant Anxiety

Posts.Content: Thank you very much, Raggarty for taking the time to share your journey with me. I too suffer terribly with regular hot flushes, nightsweats, dryness, irritation, etc, etc and for sure affecting my life. Somehow, i try my best to manage ..... although I get so fed-up (maybe I shouldn't say that!!). I have a good team of doctors, which is most reassuring but unfortunately, I am told that there is no cure and I must also learn to manage my anxiety attacks by breathing exercises, meditation and focus, exercising, etc.....which I have tried but not helping much. The worst part is the anxiety attacks seem to have a will of its own and appears whenever and the physical symptoms of nausea, palpitations, tremors, cold sweats are truly hard to bear. i will try counselling and hope that it will really help. Thank you once again. Take care
Posts.Title: Constant Anxiety

Posts.Content: Hiya Pfom, really appreciate you responding to my post. The very strange thing about me is that i was alright from the start of my diagnosis, to my mastectomy, to my seroma, to my chemotherapy, to adjusting my life around, etc and when all is done and am put on Tamoxifen, my emotions seemed to be having a meltdown! My doctor also mentioned that I accepted all that is happening but my subconscious is not. Ahhhh.....this is not rational to me. Yes, I am planning to give counselling a try and I truly hope that I could achieve the same goal as you.....being Anxiety free. Thank you once again. Take care
Posts.Title: Constant Anxiety

Posts.Content: Thank you Mistymoley for your reply and you are right, we have been given a second chance. Just wish that the low moods and anxiety attacks would go away.....my doctor wouldn't hear of me stopping Tamoxifen!!
Posts.Title: Constant Anxiety

Posts.Content: Hello Paula, are you still taking CBT and propranolol?? Did you know why you had these attacks?

Posts.Content: Hiya Deirdre, many thanks for sharing with me. I do my walks too and it does help. However, my anxiety attacks just pops up whenever, doesn't matter if am at home or work. It's awful to wait for it to pass. The funny thing is that this has never happened to me and when it started, I thought I was sick and referred this to my doctor ......then only I was told I am having anxiety / panic attacks. Best of luck in your treatment and wish you well

Posts.Title: Constant Anxiety

Posts.Content: Hiya Jo, I am still pretty much in the system as I have follow up appointments separately with my surgeon, oncologist and endocrinologist on a three monthly basis And my gynaecologis, every six months. Have spoken to each of them and the conclusion is the same but then again, they also said that every woman is different with their side effects on chemotherapy and Tamoxifen. Wishing the best in your treatments.....take care

Posts.Title: Constant Anxiety

Posts.Content: Just wondering if anyone can help me with easing my anxiety attacks. Have had anxiety attacks since I was diagnosed but lately, it is on a daily basis. It is getting worse as I feel nausea, no appetite, chills, sad and crying for no reason. Have spoken to my doctors and they said that chemotherapy has made me menopausal and Tamoxifen has surpressed my hormones, therefore causing this. It is really so difficult to handle my anxieties and it's physical symptoms everyday. Doctor said that there's no cure and my body needs time to get used to its present condition. Is this really true? It is really horrible living like this. Really appreciate if anyone could advise. Many thanks
Posts.Title: Constant Anxiety

Posts.Content: Hiya Puzzler, i really agree with you, everyone around me keeping saying ....it will be ok....it gets better with time.....you are strong and can do it, etc, etc. The truth is I am not alright, everytime I get an anxiety attack, it is not nice at all. ....plus getting very bad hot flushes. Every time, I bring up my condition, my doctor keeps assuring me that it's normal for some women .......is it???? Many thanks for your reply.....take care
Posts.Title: Constant Anxiety

Posts.Content: Many thanks Grogg..... like your daughter, acknowledging anxiety is the easy part.... it is going through and waiting for it to pass is the hardest and not nice at all. I have not tried music......will give this a shot.....thank you for sharing
Posts.Title: Constant Anxiety

Posts.Content: That's exactly how I feel too......overwhelming and always sad......can't seem to shake it off. BIG hugs to you and hope all will be better for the both of us

Posts.Content: Hello Kacang, I have spoken to my surgeon, oncologist and endocrinologist and all of them have given me the same answer. Chemotherapy has made me menopausal and Tamoxifen has surpressed the hormones, which resulted in low mood....it's normal!!! Also, am told to give my body time to adjust. Frankly, I don't feel "normal" and I really don't know how long it is going to be till I am normal. Sorry, I just had to rant. Thank you for listening
Posts.Title: Constant Anxiety

Posts.Content: Hello Sue, my apologies for the delay in replying. Thank you for taking the time to share your journey with me.  Yes, the medications are lowering our hormones and could be causing the low moods / anxiety / depression. At least my doctors are telling me this and advising me to give it time for my body to get used to the new me.  Yes, I totally agree......it is a horrible and I feel like a wimp, crying and not handling my emotions that well. I really hope and pray that we all get better. Take care
